intro: Gilia matthewsii, commonly known as the Matthews' gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink to purple. The plant is perennial and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and branching. Gilia matthewsii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
